alert.note: Alert for Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 3:02AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Montana, including the following county, Madison. Mainly for small streams and creeks that flow out of the Tobacco Root Mountains. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 AM MDT, the combination of recent rainfall and snowmelt in the advisory area has resulted in small stream flooding and water flowing over roadways in the Pony area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pony, Harrison, Mcallister and Norris. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
